definition: bosom/heart/mind/to think of/to harbor in one's mind/to conceive (a child)

sentences.english: If pregnant, take an iron supplement, as recommended by an obstetrician or other health care provider.
sentences.chinese: 如怀孕，要在妇产医生的指导下食用补铁的食物。

sentences.english: Pregnancy has you looking better than ever
sentences.chinese: 你怀孕后看起来比以前任何时候都美。

sentences.english: Being talented just like being gravid , must be known with a long time past.
sentences.chinese: 怀才就像怀孕，时间长了才能知道。

sentences.english: Now when she had weaned Loruhamah, she conceived, and bare a son.
sentences.chinese: 歌篾给罗路哈玛断奶以后，又怀孕生了一个儿子。

sentences.english: This helps the doctor estimate how long you have been pregnant and your due date.
sentences.chinese: 这可以帮助医生评估你怀孕的日期以及预定产期。

sentences.english: When Clara becomes pregnant, it's the happiest day of their lives.
sentences.chinese: 当嘉娜证实怀孕，那他们人生中最快乐的一天。

sentences.english: The other factors may be timing of conception.
sentences.chinese: 很有可能是怀孕的时间这个因素。

sentences.english: Female patients can not be used during pregnancy phototherapy treatment.
sentences.chinese: 女性患者在怀孕期间不能使用光疗的治疗方法。

sentences.english: And she conceived again， and bare a son； and she called his name Onan.
sentences.chinese: 她又怀孕生了儿子，母亲给他起名叫俄南。

sentences.english: The married patient hopes to conceive after completing a test tube baby programme.
sentences.chinese: 已婚的德亚希望试管婴儿项目完成后自己能怀孕。

sentences.english: The pregnancy was Esme's catalyst to escape.
sentences.chinese: 怀孕促成了埃斯梅的逃走。

sentences.english: Some cows slip their calves in the early stages of pregnancy.
sentences.chinese: 有些母牛在怀孕初期小产。

sentences.english: Month of pregnancy, bring joy zijun.
sentences.chinese: 子月怀孕，给子君带来欣喜。

sentences.english: Smart people say dumb stuff when faced with someone else's pregnancy.
sentences.chinese: 潇洒的人说面临某人怀孕时没有发言权。

sentences.english: Piao Neng in tender latter two stores the year to be pregnant again is more ideal.
sentences.chinese: 朴能在娇后两屯年再怀孕较为理想。

sentences.english: Antenatal diagnosis is usually made after 22 weeks of gestation.
sentences.chinese: 通常在产前检查时发现此肿瘤约为怀孕22周以后。

definition: to become pregnant/to carry a child in the womb
to have a miscarriage/miscarriage/to fail/to fall through
expected date of childbirth/estimated due date (EDD)
(of a married couple) to have intercourse/(literary) to share the same room/of the same family branch
to bear/to give birth/to grow/to rear/to bring up (children)/fertility
marriage arranged following a pregnancy/marriage necessitated by an unplanned pregnancy
